title: Couples Discount
description: Andy returns after three months to an angry office and an even angrier girlfriend, and Jim's Valentines Day with Pam does not go as planned.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Hey. I feel so lucky we're in the same city for Valentine's Day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's like magic. Or, it's like me getting on my hands and knees and begging my partners to switch a Tuesday for a Thursday.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [makes magic trick hand gesture] Alakazam!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: By the way, they do need an extra day next week.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And, poof! He disappears. [Jim snaps, playing along]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [to Pete] Hey! Wanna play hookey today?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh, maybe. What do you have in mind?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We can do anything you want.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I really wanna have fun today because tomorrow is going to be a nightmare. Andy's coming back from his stupid, dumb boat trip. He's been rude. He's been selfish. I think he's a big jerk. And I'm breaking up with him. Bam, Andy! How do you like me now?... I hope as a friend.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Erin says she's gonna break up with Andy, but I'm not sure. He's coming back tomorrow and surprise, today, she wants to do whatever I'd like. You know, when I was a kid, we had a dog who go real sick and we had to 'send him to a farm'. And on his last day, we did everything he loved.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [has an idea and reveals a frisbee from under her desk] Wanna play catch in the parking lot?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [slightly surprised] Sure.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: I'll get my coat.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Perfect. [Pete walks away eying the camera knowingly]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [knocks on Andy's door, then pretends to answer as Andy] Come in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [talking to Andy's empty chair] Andy, hi. I just made another huge sale for the company that you manage. I need you to authorize that expense report and sign off on that contract.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [pretending to be Andy] I would be happy to. It would be my pleasure, Mr. Schrute. Rick-a-dick-doo, rick-a-dick-dick-dick, rick-a-dick-doo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I really like Andy these days. He's pretend and he does exactly as I tell him to. All that will change when real Andy comes back tomorrow. [thinks for a moment] Unless he comes back as pretend Dwight. In which case, we're in for an epic, confusing showdown.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy left a carton of milk in the fridge. So, I've been sneaking a little bit every day for the last three months. It's been yummy. But now, Andy's coming back. So, I guess it's goodbye chunky, lemon milk.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to entire office]OK, I'll say it. I wish Andy had stayed on his trip.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I say we all have one last fun boss-less day.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, let's get some booze and some cocaine and just blow it out. No consequences.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Or the mini mall. They have all these Valentine Day deals. You can get 20% off if you come in with your husband or your [to Nellie] boyfriend. But, I mean, if you don't have one of those you can probably just bring whoever it is you use to kill your loneliness.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Phil, I'll pretend to be your husband. I'm already sick of you, so it'll seem realistic.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: They have a nail salon there where I get my feet detailed. [to Meredith] They use a watch repair kit.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Angela] Ew! I'll be your foot buddy.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Everyone, it is our last day here with no manager. I say we go to the mini mall. Clark, you will be my fake boyfriend so I can get the discount.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: It's what I do. [everyone begins to leave]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Darryl, everyone seems to be pairing off. Do you want to pretend to be a couple so we get the...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No... yes, yes. Why wouldn't I... wanna pretend to be gay? Got no problem with that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: All right, it'll be easy. Don't be nervous, just follow my...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [interrupting] Stop talking 'bout it. I said I'm fine with it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [eating] These are gross.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: They are terrible.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, hey, don't fill up on chocolates. I made us a lunch reservation at State Street Grill.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my god. That's so romantic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's with Brian and Alyssa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my god. That's less romantic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. But we should go. We need to thank him for, you know, saving my life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah. No, totally. That's good. So, should we just get a bottle of wine later and celebrate?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That sounds nice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm very excited to see Brian. Brian's a great guy. And Pam and I have gotten really close to he and his wife, Alyssa over the years. And he got fired for protecting my wife from a jerk in the warehouse. I'm sorry, but you know him. He's a good guy.

quotes.speaker: Nail Stylist #1
quotes.text: Oh, tiny, poor lady is back. Oh, get the baby clipper. [other nails stylists gush over Angela]

quotes.speaker: Nail Stylist #2
quotes.text: [to Clark] You take off your glasses.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: 'Kay. [removes glasses]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [nail stylist 2 giggles] What?

quotes.speaker: Nail Stylist #2
quotes.text: Your boyfriend. He look like a pretty girl.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: My boyfriend does look like a pretty girl, doesn't he? Yes, a very little pretty girl. And you know what, now that you are developing, we should go and get you a training bra. [both laugh at Clark]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh, you guys think this is funny? You know what? No more discount. [to nail manager] Excuse me. [gesturing he and Nellie] Full price. We're not together.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, come on!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: She's living a lie.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Turns out, I can't even be in a pretend relationship.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [to nail manager] Hi. We'd like a couples discount on a pair of foot massages.

quotes.speaker: Nail Salon Manager
quotes.text: No. No discount for two men. Two men are not a couple.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We are together. Romantically.

quotes.speaker: Nail Salon Manager
quotes.text: Two men? [other nail stylist speaks Korean to manager, both laugh] [gestures index fingers bumping together] Doesn't work. No discount.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, it works. Him and me, all right, we are crazy in love. More love than your small mind can comprehend. And we have two disposable incomes. And no kids. And we're taking our business elsewhere. [Oscar and Darryl exit holding hands]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [enters restaurant with Pam] Hey, Brian.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry we're late.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Oh, uh, no problem. I finished all the bread.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ha,ha,ha, yeah OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's on a no carb thing. Supposedly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: It's, uh, great to see you guys. Thanks for coming.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you kidding? Thank you, man. I mean, I've wanted the opportunity to say thanks for... everything. And I'm really sorry about the job. That just seems crazy.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: It's fine. What are you gonna do, you know? But, if you guys know of any work, I'm fully available.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, my dad can't hear a thing. You could boom his whole life for him.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: That's... OK, great. Does he pay well?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where's Alyssa?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Uh, yeah. Um, you know, Alyssa's, she's not gonna make it today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Actually, we're not gonna make it. Um... we're splitting up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Andy's empty chair] I have yet another sales order for you to sign.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [acting as Andy] Why thank you Mr. Schrute. I don't know how you do it. You're a god. Rick-a-dick-dick-doo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in his office doorway, bearded and unkept] Hi Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're back. [surveys Andy] And you're disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [as everyone returns to the office] Ah, geez. My nails aren't dry yet. I don't think I can work for at least a couple hours.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, well, well, look who it is.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I guess I can cancel my order from Zappos.com because, oh, the loafers have arrived.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey! Sweetheart! [approaches Erin] I have missed you so much.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [obviously avoiding Andy's embrace] Yes. [gives Andy high fives] Welcome back, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [attempting to hug Erin as she resists] I have been dreaming of this moment.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Me too. So much. I'm so happy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I am really, really bad at break ups. Technically, I'm still dating my first grade boyfriend. I mean, we just had our 20th anniversary. And, I forgot to get him something.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What happened? We thought you were coming back tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, Valentine's surprise for Erin.  Hello? Super romantic. And I got you something. [removes wooden instruments from bag] Oh, it's a couple of pieces of bamboo. Big deal, right? No. These are musical instruments. It's so we can play island music together. Cause I have this. [removes güiro and begins playing and singing] Clop the cloppers. Yeah, clop 'em. It's called Bembe. [sings while Kevin echoes]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Burning Man, if it's not selling out too much, you might want to throw on a tie. David Wallace is gonna be here in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Obviously, that's why I'm here. I mean, I came back early to surprise Erin. Happy Valentine's Day, sweetheart. [tries to embrace Erin but she begins playing cloppers] But, I'm just saying, I'm also excited about the Wallace meeting.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Why? Isn't he just coming in to rip you a new one for being gone three months?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. Please. Come on, Clark. Wallace knows that he's been gone for the last three months. [Andy stalls] Right? Wallace does know that you've been gone for the last three months?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I have no idea. I don't know what he knows or doesn't know. But we've been in touch the whole time. I mean, it's not hard to get high-speed internet in Turks de Caicos, people. It's in every Bembe cafe.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He only emailed me four times.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Question. Where's Jim?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He and Pam are having their Valentine's Day lunch.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: For two hours? Really?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So, you're concerned about peoples' long absence from their place of work?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If the shoe fits. [plays güiro and sings, Kevin echoes]

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: We were telling two different versions of the same story. And then, everything just went numb.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I mean, that's OK. It doesn't mean that it's over. Right? I mean, couples fight.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Yeah. That's the thing. When we were fighting, it weirdly felt like the relationship was still alive. And, it wasn't until we stopped fighting that, we realized that it was over. You know, it's over. [overcome by emotion] I'm sorry, this is... oh my god, OK. [to Pam] We have to stop seeing each other like this. We have to find a different way to communicate other than breaking down in front of each other.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [obviously flustered] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: At least my crying won't get you fired.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Crying?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I noticed that you landed the Scranton White Pages account. That is tremendous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And you sold it to Jan too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean... I'm impressed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughing together] Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, there's one problem. Couldn't help but notice that you offered a price point that was not approved by the head office. So... gotta run that stuff by me, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You were on a boat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On a boat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In the ocean.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK. The issue is that you need to run this stuff by me. Coolio? Are we coolio? [Dwight resists] Just say the word 'coolio'.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not gonna say it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Say it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not a word.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Coolio.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! [Andy makes a call] What do you think you're doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just gonna call the Scranton White Pages and clear this right up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't you dare! Andy!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Jan. Nard dog here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was just looking over the paperwork. I found a little hiccup.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. It appears my employee offered you a price that he was not authorized to.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispers] Coolio.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Seriously? You're calling me a few weeks after finalizing our contract to gouge me now for more money? Is that what you're doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Coolio. Coolio.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. No, no, no Jan I think you misunderstood.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Coolio.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It, it's, it's actually just an issue...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know what? You know what, uh, Nard dog? There is an option in the contract that allows me to back out within 30 days of signing. So, I would like to exercise that option.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Jan! Please do not listen to this boob! Remember Clark. He gave you everything. Everything.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jan, I don't know what he's talking about but...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Tell Angela to send me a final invoice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, ah, ah...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please Ja, Ja... [Jan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Aw! That was not how I had hoped that would go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [approaching Accounting] Hey, everybody, great job. [to Angela] Listen, we're a smidge behind on my paychecks.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, well, as you know, we get paid on Fridays. And you haven't been here for 12 Fridays. [hands Andy a folder]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right. Thank you very much. [examines checks] Looking good. [after noticing something on Angela's desk] Who's that little fella?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's a bonus check. For you. From Wallace. Because the branch exceeded it's targets over the past quarter.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow, that's wonderful!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: A quarter's three months. That's how long you've been gone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh-huh... [after awkward pause] Uh-huh. [Angela hands him the bonus check] Thank you. Great. Well, we're all up to speed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Two seconds of the turd dog and he loses the biggest sale this branch has ever seen.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [emotional] Do you have any idea what I had to do to get that sale from Jan? I mean, I went all out. All out. I mean like everything was out the whole week.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He just waltzes back in here like he owns the chunky, lemon milk. Who needs him, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God! I just don't know what we'd do. I mean, short of telling David Wallace that he was gone for three months.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'd like to rat out Andy. Unfortunately, I have a bit of a boy-who-cried-wolf dynamic with David Wallace. Except, instead of a boy, I'm a man. And instead of a wolf, I cried genetically-engineered monster wolf.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I'm not going to rat on him. No, Andy gave me a second chance. So, the least I could do is let somebody else rat on him. Meredith, why don't you?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Meredith Palmer ain't never been called no nark. Floozy? Yes. Alkie? Check. Einstein sarcastically? You bet. But never no nark. Vomit mop? Sure. Floor meat? That's me. Flesh hoover?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Meredith, that's plenty. All right? That's more than plenty. Why does no one stop her?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Guys. I know that a lot of people are mad at Andy and, believe me, I am too. But, he has been through a lot and we all used to love him, right? So, if he's gonna get in trouble, just let it be his fault not ours. I don't want that on my hands.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine! The state he's in, Wallace will take one look at him and probably fire him anyway.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [appears approaching group, shaved and in a suit] What's going on in here, dirty players? Let's get back to busting some paper rhymes. Come on. [singing] Who's that girl? Who's that girl? It's Andy! [resumes talking] All right. Back to work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, I can tell you're mad at me. Do you wanna just, um, I don't know, tell me why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know. I thought that was a little weird. You told me Brian got fired for the whole warehouse thing. And you intentionally left out a kind of major, intimate detail. I don't know, Pam, I guess I just feel like a chump. Who knows less about his marriage than the sound guy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I didn't tell you about the crying because I didn't want you to know how upset I was. Because it would've stressed you out and you're always saying how much you don't want more stress.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, well. Yeah, OK. Well, then thank you. Thanks to both of you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's not Brian's fault.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you're right. And, and I'm not mad at Brian. And to be honest, I probably don't have any reason to be mad at all because I wasn't there. So, let's just forget about it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I need you guys to tell me all the highlights from the last three months in case David asks. Just a few things I could sprinkle into conversation. Any big sales or office gossip.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, we had the Scranton White Pages.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not helpful. Let's stay positive, people. OK?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [enters] Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey! David! How are ya? Ah, we were just having our weekly round table where we motivate each other. Not gonna lie, I get as much out of it as they do.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Sounds great. Don't let me interrupt. What ever you guys have been doing this last quarter, I couldn't be happier with the numbers.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well, finish up. I'm gonna meet with Val about that warehouse guy you had to let go and you and I will talk in 15 minutes?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [leaving] Great job, everybody!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [whispering] We had to let a warehouse guy go?!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You know Pam's mural? Well, Frank...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [interrupting] ... lit the whole thing on fire. It was crazy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There was a fire in the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The whole thing is in ashes. Fire department was here. It was in all the papers.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is what I'm talking about! This would be good to know. All right, what else?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We started selling balloons.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah. And, uh, Kathy Ireland signed on as the official spokes-babe of Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No kidding?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah. In the European billboards, she's gonna be topless.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow. Go Kathy. She's like 50.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: They're tasteful.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good, good. What else?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who knew the balloon game would be so lucrative? And thank god, right? We needed the income after the fire.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What fire?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The warehouse fire. Weren't you just down there? It's like burnt to ashes.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: It looked fine to me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [catches on to the ruse] I am speaking metaphorically, of course. You know I have lots of irons in quote-unquote fire. Well, that's one of them. You know, making sure that the warehouse logistics is a well-oiled, properly-stoked fire.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think you'll agree I explained that pretty well.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [preparing to leave] Thanks, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: All right. Everyone! [waves to office and exits]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [enters Andy's office to find him playing güiro] Fish sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really playing the scales, huh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, it just sort of sounds like noise to me now. You think I need a new fish?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't love you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I still like you, but you were gone a really long time. And, you didn't really email me all that much. You retweeted me, a lot to be fair. But I don't love you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK, I get it. You're unhappy. I've been gone a long time and we lost a little bit of juju. But, you and me, we have a future. There is a lot of love here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I just said there isn't love.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: On your side. But there's tons on my side. It's gushing. We're just out of sync right now. But that's just timing, it's timing. I mean, my parents lasted 38, 40 years. They were never happy at the same time.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I guess.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, what do we have left? 35, maybe 40 years? If we're lucky. I mean, I have spent a lot of time in the sun.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You got really sunburned.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm gonna be a prune in like, 3 years.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know you may not be feeling love for me right now but, if you fake it, I won't be able to tell the difference. So, I'll feel good. And then, eventually, maybe, you'll actually start to love me again.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You really think we can get that back?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes. [hugs Erin] Come on. Totally.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? Maybe we should cancel that bottle of wine tonight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I just feel like I got a bunch of stuff to do in Philly and I'm sure you have stuff to do. So we can just... I don't know, drop me at the bus station?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just feel like we're gonna fight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [obviously hurt] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So... how 'bout let's not?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. [they begin to leave]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, um. [pulls item from bag and hands to Pam] Happy Valentine's Day. Sorry, I didn't have time to wrap it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sees it's a drawing of hers, framed] Wow. I didn't know you kept this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No problem.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think you should go to Philly tonight. I think that you should stay and I think we should fight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You really wanna fight on Valentine's Day?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. All right, put your dukes up, Beesly.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey, you OK?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I couldn't do it.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh, you don't have to apologize. I just... I just want you to be happy. OK? [Erin smiles and kisses Pete]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [bursts into Andy's office] We're breaking up. And just so you know, I was worried that you were dead. You were gone for three months.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Andy. It's David. Still here. What was that about three months?
